{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Facility Officer",
  "description": "ConSol Limited, is the leading provider of Contact/Call Center services and Customer Management Solutions in Nigeria.With over 13 years of experience working with leading brands across 17 industries in Nigeria, our consulting service is focused on helping you effectively acquire, satisfy, engage and retain your customers through your contact centre operations.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Facility Officer
Job Location:&nbsp;Ilupeju, Lagos&nbsp;
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	The Facility Officer is responsible for the day-to-day maintenance, safety, and efficient operation of the organization&rsquo;s facilities. The role ensures that buildings, equipment, and services are well maintained and compliant with health, safety, and regulatory standards.


Key Responsibilities


	Monitor and maintain building infrastructure, utilities, and facilities equipment
	Coordinate routine inspections, repairs, and preventive maintenance activities
	Supervise external vendors, contractors, and service providers
	Ensure cleanliness, security, and safety of the facility at all times
	Respond promptly to facility-related issues, breakdowns, or emergencies
	Maintain records of maintenance activities, repairs, and service contracts
	Ensure compliance with health, safety, and environmental regulations
	Assist in space management, office setup, and facility improvements
	Support budget control by monitoring facility-related expenses
	Report facility conditions and recommend improvements to management


Requirements &amp; Qualifications


	OND/HND/BSc in Facilities Management, Engineering, Building Technology, or a related field
	1&ndash;3 years of relevant experience in facility or building management
	Basic knowledge of electrical, plumbing, HVAC, and general maintenance
	Understanding of health and safety regulations
	Good communication and coordination skills
	Ability to multitask and work with minimal supervision
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Outlook)


Key Skills &amp; Competencies:


	Facility and maintenance management
	Vendor and contractor coordination
	Problem-solving and attention to detail
	Time management and organization
	Cost control and reporting
	Teamwork and reliability


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;apply@consollimited.com&nbsp;using&nbsp;the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

  "validThrough": "2026-02-01",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",

    "@type": "Organization",

  },

      "addressCountry": "NG"
     
      
    }
  },

  },

Facility Officer Job at ConSol Limited




        
    

        
        ConSol Limited, is the leading provider of Contact/Call Center services and Customer Management Solutions in Nigeria.With over 13 years of experience working with leading brands across 17 industries in Nigeria, our consulting service is focused on helping you effectively acquire, satisfy, engage and retain your customers through your contact centre operations.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Facility Officer
Job Location: Ilupeju, Lagos 
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

            
    




	The Facility Officer is responsible for the day-to-day maintenance, safety, and efficient operation of the organization’s facilities. The role ensures that buildings, equipment, and services are well maintained and compliant with health, safety, and regulatory standards.


Key Responsibilities


	Monitor and maintain building infrastructure, utilities, and facilities equipment
	Coordinate routine inspections, repairs, and preventive maintenance activities
	Supervise external vendors, contractors, and service providers
	Ensure cleanliness, security, and safety of the facility at all times
	Respond promptly to facility-related issues, breakdowns, or emergencies
	Maintain records of maintenance activities, repairs, and service contracts
	Ensure compliance with health, safety, and environmental regulations
	Assist in space management, office setup, and facility improvements
	Support budget control by monitoring facility-related expenses
	Report facility conditions and recommend improvements to management


Requirements & Qualifications


	OND/HND/BSc in Facilities Management, Engineering, Building Technology, or a related field
	1–3 years of relevant experience in facility or building management
	Basic knowledge of electrical, plumbing, HVAC, and general maintenance
	Understanding of health and safety regulations
	Good communication and coordination skills
	Ability to multitask and work with minimal supervision
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Outlook)


Key Skills & Competencies:


	Facility and maintenance management
	Vendor and contractor coordination
	Problem-solving and attention to detail
	Time management and organization
	Cost control and reporting
	Teamwork and reliability


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: apply@consollimited.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply

  "description": "Estacy travels is a travels and tour company that aids in assisting travelers in and outside a country . We are fully involved in visa processing, abroad birth, tour and and school service

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Visa Processing Officer
Job Location: Lekki, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary&nbsp;


	We&#39;re seeking a detail-oriented and customer-focused individual to oversee the visa application process. As a Visa Officer, you&#39;ll review and process applications, verify documents, assess applicant eligibility, and ensure adherence to immigration regulations and organizational policies.
	This role demands strong analytical and communication skills, as well as a commitment to delivering exceptional service to applicants.


Key Responsibilities


	Process and review visa applications
	Verify documentation and assess applicant eligibility
	Ensure compliance with immigration laws and policies
	Provide excellent customer service to applicants.


Salary
N150,000 - N180,000 per month.&nbsp;

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;recruitment@estacytravels.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

Visa Processing Officer Job at Estacy Travels




        
    

        
        Estacy travels is a travels and tour company that aids in assisting travelers in and outside a country . We are fully involved in visa processing, abroad birth, tour and and school service

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Visa Processing Officer
Job Location: Lekki, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary 
     

            
    




	We're seeking a detail-oriented and customer-focused individual to oversee the visa application process. As a Visa Officer, you'll review and process applications, verify documents, assess applicant eligibility, and ensure adherence to immigration regulations and organizational policies.
	This role demands strong analytical and communication skills, as well as a commitment to delivering exceptional service to applicants.


Key Responsibilities


	Process and review visa applications
	Verify documentation and assess applicant eligibility
	Ensure compliance with immigration laws and policies
	Provide excellent customer service to applicants.


Salary
N150,000 - N180,000 per month. 

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: recruitment@estacytravels.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "General Manager",
  "description": "FMG Platform is a pioneering Mentoring, Business Development, and Empowerment initiative dedicated to helping individuals, families, cooperatives, organizations, and government agencies achieve financial independence and success. Our platform empowers members (Associates) with mentorship, wealth-enhancing products, and services provided through our network of affiliated companies.

We believe in creating opportunities for everyone , regardless of their background or financial situation, to start businesses, accelerate profitability, and build fulfilling, stress-free lives. With access to expert guidance, capacity-building programs, and discounted services in real estate, insurance, and business support, FMG members are positioned for unparalleled growth

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: General Manager

Job Location:&nbsp;Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time
Reports To: Board of Directors / Managing Director

Job Summary


	The General Manager (GM) is responsible for the overall strategic leadership, operational management, and financial performance of the company&rsquo;s diversified businesses spanning Insurance services, Real Estate development and management, and Empowerment &amp; Training programs.
	GM will drive growth, ensure regulatory compliance, strengthen partnerships, and lead cross-functional teams to achieve the organization&rsquo;s vision and objectives.


Key Responsibilities
Strategic Leadership &amp; Business Development:


	Develop and implement company-wide strategies across Insurance, Real Estate, and Training/Empowerment portfolios.
	Identify new business opportunities, partnerships, and revenue streams.
	Translate board-approved strategies into actionable operational plans.
	Monitor industry trends, regulatory changes, and market dynamics to maintain competitiveness.


Operations &amp; Performance Management:


	Oversee daily operations across all business units to ensure efficiency and quality service delivery.
	Set performance targets and KPIs for departments and ensure accountability.
	Coordinate inter-departmental activities to maximize synergies across business lines.
	Ensure proper documentation, reporting, and process optimization.


Financial Management:


	Prepare and manage annual budgets, forecasts, and financial plans.
	Monitor cash flow, profitability, and cost controls across all operations.
	Ensure accurate financial reporting and compliance with accounting standards.
	Support fundraising, investment, and grant opportunities where applicable.


Regulatory Compliance &amp; Risk Management:


	Ensure full compliance with relevant laws and regulatory bodies (e.g. Insurance regulators, real estate authorities, training/accreditation bodies).
	Establish and enforce internal controls, risk management, and corporate governance frameworks.
	Oversee contract management, policies, and legal obligations.


People Management &amp; Organizational Development:


	Lead, mentor, and manage senior management and staff across departments.
	Foster a high-performance, ethical, and inclusive work culture.
	Oversee recruitment, capacity building, training, and performance appraisals.
	Promote staff development aligned with company goals.


Stakeholder &amp; Client Relations:


	Represent the company in high-level engagements with regulators, partners, clients, donors, and investors.
	Strengthen customer relations and ensure excellent service delivery.
	Build strong relationships with government agencies, financial institutions, and community stakeholders.


Empowerment &amp; Training Programs Oversight:


	Provide strategic oversight for empowerment and training initiatives.
	Ensure programs are impactful, sustainable, and aligned with organizational objectives.
	Monitor outcomes, reporting, and impact assessment of training programs.


Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)


	Revenue growth and profitability across business units.
	Operational efficiency and service quality.
	Regulatory compliance and risk management effectiveness.
	Staff performance, retention, and development.
	Successful implementation and impact of empowerment and training programs.


Qualifications &amp; Experience


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Business Administration, Management, Finance, Insurance, Real Estate, or a related field.
	8 - 12 years relevant work experience, with at least 5 years in a senior management or leadership role.
	Master&rsquo;s Degree (MBA or equivalent) is an added advantage.
	Proven experience in at least two of the following sectors: Insurance, Real Estate, Training/Empowerment, Financial Services.
	Strong understanding of regulatory and compliance requirements.


Key Skills &amp; Competencies:


	Strategic thinking and business acumen.
	Strong leadership and people management skills.
	Financial planning and analytical skills.
	Excellent communication, negotiation, and stakeholder management abilities.
	Risk management and compliance knowledge.
	Results-driven with strong problem-solving skills.


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Cover Letter and CV in PDF Format as a single document, attached in an email to:&nbsp;hadaba.gresource@gmail.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as specified above, as the subject of the email.",

General Manager Job at FMG Platform




        
    

        
        FMG Platform is a pioneering Mentoring, Business Development, and Empowerment initiative dedicated to helping individuals, families, cooperatives, organizations, and government agencies achieve financial independence and success. Our platform empowers members (Associates) with mentorship, wealth-enhancing products, and services provided through our network of affiliated companies.

We believe in creating opportunities for everyone , regardless of their background or financial situation, to start businesses, accelerate profitability, and build fulfilling, stress-free lives. With access to expert guidance, capacity-building programs, and discounted services in real estate, insurance, and business support, FMG members are positioned for unparalleled growth
     

            
    



We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: General Manager

Job Location: Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time
Reports To: Board of Directors / Managing Director

Job Summary


	The General Manager (GM) is responsible for the overall strategic leadership, operational management, and financial performance of the company’s diversified businesses spanning Insurance services, Real Estate development and management, and Empowerment & Training programs.
	GM will drive growth, ensure regulatory compliance, strengthen partnerships, and lead cross-functional teams to achieve the organization’s vision and objectives.


Key Responsibilities
Strategic Leadership & Business Development:


	Develop and implement company-wide strategies across Insurance, Real Estate, and Training/Empowerment portfolios.
	Identify new business opportunities, partnerships, and revenue streams.
	Translate board-approved strategies into actionable operational plans.
	Monitor industry trends, regulatory changes, and market dynamics to maintain competitiveness.


Operations & Performance Management:


	Oversee daily operations across all business units to ensure efficiency and quality service delivery.
	Set performance targets and KPIs for departments and ensure accountability.
	Coordinate inter-departmental activities to maximize synergies across business lines.
	Ensure proper documentation, reporting, and process optimization.


Financial Management:


	Prepare and manage annual budgets, forecasts, and financial plans.
	Monitor cash flow, profitability, and cost controls across all operations.
	Ensure accurate financial reporting and compliance with accounting standards.
	Support fundraising, investment, and grant opportunities where applicable.


Regulatory Compliance & Risk Management:


	Ensure full compliance with relevant laws and regulatory bodies (e.g. Insurance regulators, real estate authorities, training/accreditation bodies).
	Establish and enforce internal controls, risk management, and corporate governance frameworks.
	Oversee contract management, policies, and legal obligations.


People Management & Organizational Development:


	Lead, mentor, and manage senior management and staff across departments.
	Foster a high-performance, ethical, and inclusive work culture.
	Oversee recruitment, capacity building, training, and performance appraisals.
	Promote staff development aligned with company goals.


Stakeholder & Client Relations:


	Represent the company in high-level engagements with regulators, partners, clients, donors, and investors.
	Strengthen customer relations and ensure excellent service delivery.
	Build strong relationships with government agencies, financial institutions, and community stakeholders.


Empowerment & Training Programs Oversight:


	Provide strategic oversight for empowerment and training initiatives.
	Ensure programs are impactful, sustainable, and aligned with organizational objectives.
	Monitor outcomes, reporting, and impact assessment of training programs.


Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)


	Revenue growth and profitability across business units.
	Operational efficiency and service quality.
	Regulatory compliance and risk management effectiveness.
	Staff performance, retention, and development.
	Successful implementation and impact of empowerment and training programs.


Qualifications & Experience


	Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration, Management, Finance, Insurance, Real Estate, or a related field.
	8 - 12 years relevant work experience, with at least 5 years in a senior management or leadership role.
	Master’s Degree (MBA or equivalent) is an added advantage.
	Proven experience in at least two of the following sectors: Insurance, Real Estate, Training/Empowerment, Financial Services.
	Strong understanding of regulatory and compliance requirements.


Key Skills & Competencies:


	Strategic thinking and business acumen.
	Strong leadership and people management skills.
	Financial planning and analytical skills.
	Excellent communication, negotiation, and stakeholder management abilities.
	Risk management and compliance knowledge.
	Results-driven with strong problem-solving skills.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Cover Letter and CV in PDF Format as a single document, attached in an email to: hadaba.gresource@gmail.com using the Job Position as specified above, as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Procurement Finance Officer",
  "description": "Brands Optimal Limited is one of Africa&rsquo;s leading Experiential Marketing Agency which optimizes value for client through the use of strategic, reliable and measurable method in consumer engagement, loyalty seeding and sales generation.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Procurement Finance Officer
Job Location:&nbsp;Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Industry: Experiential Marketing

Job Description


	We are seeking a meticulous and proactive Procurement Finance Officer to support our procurement and finance operations.


Responsibilities
The Procurement Finance Officer will ensure financial accuracy, cost efficiency and verification of all procurement-related transactions. Key duties include:


	Verifying and confirming that all prices of items requested or purchased are accurate, competitive and properly approved.
	Reviewing vendor quotations, invoices, purchase orders and supporting documents for correctness and compliance with company standards.
	Ensuring cost-saving measures are incorporated into procurement activities.
	Supporting procurement processes by validating pricing, quantities and vendor details before final approval.
	Maintaining an updated database of vendor price lists and market rates.
	Identifying price discrepancies and escalating issues for prompt resolution.
	Collaborating with the Procurement and Finance teams to ensure seamless execution of purchasing activities.
	Assisting in the reconciliation of procurement transactions and expenditure reports.
	Participating in vendor evaluation and maintaining proper procurement documentation.


Requirements


	HND / B.Sc. in Accounting, Finance, Economics, Business Administration or any related field with a minimum qualification of Upper Credit or Second Class Upper Division.
	Prior experience in procurement finance, accounts or relevant operations is an added advantage.
	Excellent analytical skills with strong attention to detail.
	Sound understanding of pricing verification and basic procurement procedures.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and basic accounting tools.
	Strong communication, documentation and coordination skills.
	Ability to work with accuracy under pressure and meet deadlines.


Benefits


	Competitive salary and benefits package
	Opportunities for career development and training
	A supportive and collaborative work environment.


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV / Resume to:&nbsp;jobs@brandsoptimal.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

Procurement Finance Officer Job at Brands Optimal Limited




        
    

        
        Brands Optimal Limited is one of Africa’s leading Experiential Marketing Agency which optimizes value for client through the use of strategic, reliable and measurable method in consumer engagement, loyalty seeding and sales generation.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Procurement Finance Officer
Job Location: Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Industry: Experiential Marketing

Job Description
     

            
    




	We are seeking a meticulous and proactive Procurement Finance Officer to support our procurement and finance operations.


Responsibilities
The Procurement Finance Officer will ensure financial accuracy, cost efficiency and verification of all procurement-related transactions. Key duties include:


	Verifying and confirming that all prices of items requested or purchased are accurate, competitive and properly approved.
	Reviewing vendor quotations, invoices, purchase orders and supporting documents for correctness and compliance with company standards.
	Ensuring cost-saving measures are incorporated into procurement activities.
	Supporting procurement processes by validating pricing, quantities and vendor details before final approval.
	Maintaining an updated database of vendor price lists and market rates.
	Identifying price discrepancies and escalating issues for prompt resolution.
	Collaborating with the Procurement and Finance teams to ensure seamless execution of purchasing activities.
	Assisting in the reconciliation of procurement transactions and expenditure reports.
	Participating in vendor evaluation and maintaining proper procurement documentation.


Requirements


	HND / B.Sc. in Accounting, Finance, Economics, Business Administration or any related field with a minimum qualification of Upper Credit or Second Class Upper Division.
	Prior experience in procurement finance, accounts or relevant operations is an added advantage.
	Excellent analytical skills with strong attention to detail.
	Sound understanding of pricing verification and basic procurement procedures.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and basic accounting tools.
	Strong communication, documentation and coordination skills.
	Ability to work with accuracy under pressure and meet deadlines.


Benefits


	Competitive salary and benefits package
	Opportunities for career development and training
	A supportive and collaborative work environment.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV / Resume to: jobs@brandsoptimal.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Payable Officer",
  "description": "Brands Optimal Limited is one of Africa&rsquo;s leading Experiential Marketing Agency which optimizes value for client through the use of strategic, reliable and measurable method in consumer engagement, loyalty seeding and sales generation.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Payable Officer

Job Location:Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type:Full-time
Industry: Experiential Marketing

Job Summary


	We are seeking a detail-oriented and highly organized Payable Officer to join our Finance team.


Responsibilities
The Payable Officer will be responsible for managing and validating all outgoing payments and financial obligations of the company, including:


	Verifying and confirming the accuracy, authenticity and completeness before all payment processing.
	Ensuring that all supporting documents (invoices, memos, approvals, vendor details, etc.) are correct and properly filed.
	Processing vendor payments, staff claims, reimbursements and other payables promptly.
	Maintaining an up-to-date record of all payables and ensuring timely settlement.
	Liaising with vendors, internal departments, and relevant stakeholders for confirmation of transactions.
	Reconciling payment records with bank statements and internal financial reports.
	Flagging discrepancies, errors or questionable transactions for further review.
	Supporting the Finance Department in audits, reporting, and administrative tasks.


Requirements and Skills


	HND / B.Sc. in Accounting, Finance or any related field with a minimum qualification of Upper Credit or Second Class Upper Division.
	2 - 4 years of experience as a payable officer.
	Proven experience in accounts payable or a similar finance role is an added advantage.
	Strong analytical and verification skills.
	Excellent attention to detail and high level of accuracy.
	Proficiency in MS Excel and basic accounting tools.
	Strong communication and documentation skills.
	Ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines.


What We Offer


	Competitive salary and benefits package
	Opportunities for career development and training
	A supportive and collaborative work environment.


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should forward their Resume to:&nbsp;jobs@brandsoptimal.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

Payable Officer Job at Brands Optimal Limited




        
    

        
        Brands Optimal Limited is one of Africa’s leading Experiential Marketing Agency which optimizes value for client through the use of strategic, reliable and measurable method in consumer engagement, loyalty seeding and sales generation.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Payable Officer

Job Location:Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type:Full-time
Industry: Experiential Marketing

Job Summary
     

            
    




	We are seeking a detail-oriented and highly organized Payable Officer to join our Finance team.


Responsibilities
The Payable Officer will be responsible for managing and validating all outgoing payments and financial obligations of the company, including:


	Verifying and confirming the accuracy, authenticity and completeness before all payment processing.
	Ensuring that all supporting documents (invoices, memos, approvals, vendor details, etc.) are correct and properly filed.
	Processing vendor payments, staff claims, reimbursements and other payables promptly.
	Maintaining an up-to-date record of all payables and ensuring timely settlement.
	Liaising with vendors, internal departments, and relevant stakeholders for confirmation of transactions.
	Reconciling payment records with bank statements and internal financial reports.
	Flagging discrepancies, errors or questionable transactions for further review.
	Supporting the Finance Department in audits, reporting, and administrative tasks.


Requirements and Skills


	HND / B.Sc. in Accounting, Finance or any related field with a minimum qualification of Upper Credit or Second Class Upper Division.
	2 - 4 years of experience as a payable officer.
	Proven experience in accounts payable or a similar finance role is an added advantage.
	Strong analytical and verification skills.
	Excellent attention to detail and high level of accuracy.
	Proficiency in MS Excel and basic accounting tools.
	Strong communication and documentation skills.
	Ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines.


What We Offer


	Competitive salary and benefits package
	Opportunities for career development and training
	A supportive and collaborative work environment.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should forward their Resume to: jobs@brandsoptimal.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.
